intro: Romulea nivalis, commonly known as the snow romulea, is a flowering plant native to the high mountain regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its compact, tufted growth habit. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange flowers with a distinctive, spurred petal at the base. It thrives in alpine environments, often growing in rocky soil at high altitudes. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a subject of interest for botanists and plant enthusiasts.
